sentences.en: " But, Sister,'said Carreen, her sweet childish face blank with consternation. " I couldn't split kindling!
sentences.cn: " 不过, 姐姐, "卡琳说, 她那张幼稚得可爱的脸上充满了惶惑的神色, " 我不会劈柴火 呀 !

sentences.en: A new power station is being built much to the consternation of environmental groups (= they are very worried about it ) .
sentences.cn: 一座新的发电厂正在建造中，这使环境保护团体大为震惊。

sentences.en: He was filled with consternation to hear that his friend was so ill.
sentences.cn: 他听说朋友病得那么厉害,感到非常震惊.

sentences.en: His decision caused consternation in the art photography community.
sentences.cn: 他的决定在艺术摄影圈内引起了恐慌。

sentences.en: His rubicund face expressed consternation and fatigue.
sentences.cn: 他那红通的脸显得又惊惶又疲乏.

sentences.en: I saw with consternation that she was in tears.
sentences.cn: 我惊恐地看到她泪流满面.

sentences.en: In consternation Tess jumped down, and discovered the dreadful truth.
sentences.cn: 苔丝大惊之下,跳下来一看, 才发现了可怕的事实.

sentences.en: Milo sniffed in consternation twice, like a shaggy brown hare.
sentences.cn: 迈洛惊愕地倒吸了两口气, 就象一只毛茸茸的棕色野兔一样.

sentences.en: Rebecca started back a picture of consternation.
Sam stared at him in consternation.
sentences.cn: 萨姆惊恐不安地注视着他。

sentences.en: The affrighted friends jumped from the table in the greatest consternation.
sentences.cn: 这两个受惊的朋友万分恐惧地从桌上跳下来.

sentences.en: The announcement of her retirement caused consternation among tennis fans.
sentences.cn: 她宣布挂拍告退的消息引起了网球迷的震惊。

sentences.en: The government’s plans have caused considerable consternation among many Americans.
sentences.cn: 政府的计划在许多美国人中间引起了相当大的恐慌。

sentences.en: The proprietress panicked, gaping in consternation.
sentences.cn: 大娘弄慌了, 把口张大合不拢去.

sentences.en: The thought of meeting him filled me with consternation.
sentences.cn: 想到要和他见面,我就惊恐不已.

sentences.en: There is some consternation among business leaders.
sentences.cn: 商界领导人中有一些惊愕.

sentences.en: To her consternation, he asked her to make a speech.
sentences.cn: 她感到惊慌的是他要求她发言.

trans.tran_en: a feeling of worry, shock, or fear
